member.summary: Zooms in the diagram. Simulates zooming with the mouse. Performs incremental zoom taking into account previous zoom operations.
member.param: The value by which to change property. When factor is null, smaller or equal to zero the value will be used.
The center of the zoom. The point should be provided in viewport coordinates.

member.summary: Zooms out the diagram. Simulates zooming with the mouse. Performs incremental zoom taking into account previous zoom operations.

The center of the zoom. The point should be provided in viewport coordinates.

member.summary: Adds a new connection to the diagram connecting the given source and target shapes.
member.param: The source or start shape of the connection.
The target or end shape of the connection.
If set to true this action will be recorded in the undo stack.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagram.AddGlidingConnection(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IShape,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IShape,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new gliding connection to the diagram connecting the given source and target shapes.
member.remarks: If the shape already contains connections on the default connectors this will raise an exception since gliding connections are mutually exclusive with normal connections. Remove first the existing connections on the source and target shapes before calling this method.
member.param: The source or start shape of the connection.
The target or end shape of the connection.
If set to true this action will be recorded in the undo stack.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagram.AddShape(System.Object,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Geometry,System.Nullable{Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new shape to the diagram.
member.remarks: The given object will be inserted as the content of a new RadDiagramShape and will internally uniquely identify the shape. Alternatively, you can instantiate a new shape and use this same AddShape method to add it to the diagram, in which case the shape rather than the content will uniquely identify it internally.
member.param: If set to true the action is undoable.
member.returns: The added shape.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.GeometryExtensions
member.summary: Methods related to planar geometry.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.GeometryExtensions.CreateConnectionGeometry(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IConnection,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.BridgeType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method is called by the connection update process to create a geometry which is then plugged into the Path in the XAML template of the connection.

list.item: The method essentially dispatches first a calculation of the route, if required, and then hands over a specification to the method.
The points defined by the given connection and the routing service are global positions, they are converted internally to local coordinates.

member.param: The connection for which to create a geometry.
What type of bridging should be applied to the line.
Whether the corners of the line should be rounded.
member.returns: The geometry of the connection path.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.GeometryExtensions.CreateLineGeometry(Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.PolylineSpecification)
member.summary: Creates a line geometry based on the given specifications.

list.item: This method will create a polyline or Bezier line including possibly the end caps and the crossings.
This method decouples between the method called by the connection () on the one hand and the more specific methods for a polyline () or a Bezier line () on the other.
All coordinates handled in this method are local positions.

member.returns: A to be used in a

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.GeometryExtensions.CreateBaseLineGeometry(Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.LineSpecification)
member.summary: Creates a line geometry based on the given specifications.

list.item: This method will create the base line of a connection. This line will including possible bridges but no end caps.
All coordinates handled in this method are local positions.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.GeometryExtensions.CreateSplineFigures(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point},System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a canonical spline figure.
member.param: The points defining the spline. These should be in local coordinates and include the endpoints.
The tension of the spline. A tension or zero will result in a polyline, a tension between 0.5 and 0.8 is pleasing, other values lead to wild curves.
If set to true the curve will be closed.
If set to true the shape will be filled .
member.remarks: Based on the code in http://www.charlespetzold.com/blog/2009/01/canonical-splines-in-wpf-and-silverlight.html.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.LineSpecification
member.summary: Parametrization of a polyline geometry which allows you to use multiple and bridges (using the data and the ). The method uses such specifications to create a concrete geometry.
member.remarks:
There are a few things to consider in relation to crossings:
None: the and will be used to define the start and end of the polyline. If some caps are used these points will be shifted if necessary so that the polyline makes space for the caps. This depends on the type of the cap.
Some bridge type: the data will define the start and end points, while the and will be irrelevant in this case.

member.summary: Gets the common geometries.

example.para: The following snippet of XAML binds this source of geometries to a ListBox;
example.code: <ListBox x:Name="ShapeList" > <ListBox.ItemTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Path Data="{Binding Path=Value}" Tag="{Binding Path=Key}" Stroke="Orange" StrokeThickness="1" Margin="2" /> </DataTemplate> </ListBox.ItemTemplate> <ListBox.ItemsPanel> <ItemsPanelTemplate> <WrapPanel Width="300" /> </ItemsPanelTemplate> </ListBox.ItemsPanel> </ListBox>

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.GetNudgeValue(System.String,Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement)
member.summary: Gets the nudge vector for the given parameter.
member.param:
The parameter defining the nudge.
The parameter can be a single string with a value taken from the enumeration, or a string of the form "direction; amount". The 'direction' being a value from the enumeration and the 'amount' options are:
'Small' literal: if is true then one or step, otherwise on pixel
'Large' literal: if is true then five or steps, otherwise on pixel
A number: the amount in pixels to nudge. If is true this value will be truncated.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.AddGlidingConnection(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IShape,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IShape,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new gliding connection to the diagram connecting the given source and target shapes.
member.remarks: If the shape already contains connections on the default connectors this will raise an exception since gliding connections are mutually exclusive with normal connections. Remove first the existing connections on the source and target shapes before calling this method.
member.param: The source or start shape of the connection.
The target or end shape of the connection.
If set to true this action will be recorded in the undo stack.

member.summary: Adds a new shape to the diagram.
member.remarks: The given object will be inserted as the content of a new RadDiagramShape and will internally uniquely identify the shape. Alternatively, you can instantiate a new shape and use this same AddShape method to add it to the diagram, in which case the shape rather than the content will uniquely identify it internally.
member.param: If set to true the action is undoable.
member.returns: The added shape.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.ZoomIn(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point})
member.summary: Zooms in the diagram. Simulates zooming with the mouse. Performs incremental zoom taking into account previous zoom operations.
member.param: The value by which to change property. When factor is null, smaller or equal to zero the value will be used.
The center of the zoom. The point should be provided in viewport coordinates.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.ZoomOut(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point})
member.summary: Zooms out the diagram. Simulates zooming with the mouse. Performs incremental zoom taking into account previous zoom operations.
member.param: The value by which to change property. When factor is null, smaller or equal to zero the value will be used.
The center of the zoom. The point should be provided in viewport coordinates.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.AutoFit
member.summary: Zoom and pans the diagram in such a way that all items will fit into the currently visible area of the canvas.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.AutoFit(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Thickness,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zoom and pans the diagram in such a way that all items will fit into the currently visible area of the canvas. If there are no items or the visible area is with empty size or the margin is greater than the visible area no action will be performed.
member.param: The margin to be used as whitespace border around the diagram items.
Determines whether animations should be used.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.AutoFitAsync(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Thickness,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zoom and pans the diagram asynchronously in such a way that all items will fit into the currently visible area of the canvas. If there are no items or the visible area is with empty size or the margin is greater than the visible area no action will be performed.
member.param: The margin to be used as whitespace border around the diagram items.
Determines whether animations should be used.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.FitTo(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Rect,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes the requested rectangle the new view port. After the rectangle is placed in the top left corner of the view port a zoom operation stretches the rectangle to occupy the whole view port. The zoom is coerced according to property restriction.
member.param: The new viewport. If the viewport is invalid (NaN or infinity for position or size) the operation will not be executed. The desired zoom level after the bring operation is determined by the ratio of new viewport width to current viewport width.
Determines whether an animation will be used.
member.returns: Whether the operation has bee executed successfully or not.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.BringIntoView(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Rect,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes the requested rectangle the new view port. After the rectangle is centered in the view port a zoom operation stretches the rectangle to occupy the whole view port. The zoom is coerced according to property restriction.
member.param: The rect to bring into view. If the rectangle is empty the operation will not be executed.
Determines whether an animation will be used.
member.returns: Whether the operation has bee executed successfully or not.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.BringIntoView(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Brings the provided point into the top left corner of the view port with the requested zoom.
member.param: The point to bring to the top left view port corner. If the position is invalid (NaN or infinity) the operation will not be executed.
The zoom level. It will be coerced according to property restriction.
Determines whether an animation will be used.
member.returns: Whether the operation has bee executed successfully or not.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.BringIntoView(System.Object,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Brings the provided item to the center of the view port with the requested zoom.
member.param: The shape to bring to the center of the view port. If the item is null or has with invalid position/size (NaN or infinity) the operation will not be executed.
The zoom level. It will be coerced according to property restriction.
Determines whether an animation will be used.
member.returns: Whether the operation has bee executed successfully or not.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.ResetViewport(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Brings the (0, 0) point into the top left corner of the view port with zoom equal to 1.
member.param: Determines whether an animation will be used.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.PanInternal(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point)
member.summary: Pans the diagram to the provided position. The values are interpreted in the zoomed coordinate system. This means that panning with 100 pixel will result in visual translation with 100 pixel.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramElement.ZoomInternal(System.Double,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,Telerik.WinControls.UI.Diagrams.ZoomType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms the diagram. With incremental zoom the difference between current zoom and new zoom will be applied in the new zoom center. This way the new zoom values will be accumulated to the previous once. With non incremental zoom (absolute) the new zoom and zoom point will clear the old zoom values.
member.param: The point where new zoom should be applied. The point should be provided in original coordinates.
Determines whether animation should be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the default Bezier definition (Bezier tangents) has been altered.

list.item: This property is set to true as soon as one of the Bezier handles has been manually modified. This means that the automatically calculated handle positions in function of the connector will be halted. You re-enable this auto-handle calculation by re-setting this property to false.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.RadDiagramConnection.GetCrossings
member.summary: Returns the information related to the crossing of this connection with other connections.

list.item: The positions in the returned data are local coordinates with respect to the bounding rectangle of this connection.

The returned data contains a collection of points for each segment. This collection starts with the startpoint of the segment and ends with the endpoint of the segment. If there is a gap or crossing then for each gap a pair of points will denote the begin/end of the gap. So, each segment collection has always at least two points.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.DiagramToHyperTreeAdapter`2
member.summary: Adapter between the diagram control and the graph representation. It converts shape and connections to nodes and edges taking into the containers and their collapse state, the visibility of items and more. If the is true a hypertree is constructed which holds the hierarchy of containers and many conditions are analyzed to investigate how the effective graph structure looks like and how the layout has to be performed.
member.typeparam: The type of the node data.
The type of the link data.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.DiagramToHyperTreeAdapter`2.Convert(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IGraph,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.GraphAnalysisSettings)
member.summary: Converts the given diagram to a .
member.remarks:
The is used when the is true. It contains the hierarchy of containers whereby each node is a . This type of node has a reference to the container which holds the items. There are three possible situations during the conversion process:
Ignore the containers: the container are non-existent and only normal shapes are mapped. If a shape has a connection to a container it will be ignored as well since there is no node mapped for the container.
Do not ignore the containers and leave the content of the containers untouched: the top-level elements are being mapped and the children within a container are not altered.
Do not ignore the containers and organize the content of the containers as well: the hypertree is constructed and there is a partitioning of all nodes and connections into the hypertree. The only reason a connection or node is not being mapped might be due to the visibility, which includes the visibility change through a collapsed parent container.
member.param: The diagram from which graph analytical information should be extracted.
The settings used to convert the diagram to a graph.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.DiagramToHyperTreeAdapter`2.IsShapeMapped(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IShape)
member.summary: Determines whether the shape is or needs to be mapped to another shape. This occurs essentially when the shape sits in a collapsed container hierarchy and an external connection needs a node endpoint. This node then corresponds to the mapped shape and is necessarily a container in the parent hierarchy of the shape.
member.returns: true if [is shape mapped] [the specified shape]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.GraphBase`2.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets whether this graph is connected. See also this article; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connected_graph.
member.remarks: A graph is connected if every two vertices are connected by a path. A connected graph has only one component.
member.value: true if this instance is connected; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.GraphBase`2.IsAcyclic
member.summary: Gets whether the graph is acyclic.

item.description: If there are no cycles in a graph it's acyclic. A cycle means a closed path or loop.

member.value: true if this instance is acyclic; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.GraphBase`2.IsHamiltonian
member.summary: Gets whether the graph is hamiltonian.

item.description: An Hamiltonian cycle is a cycle which contains all nodes of the graph. If there is at least one such cycle the graph is called Hamiltonian.
See also the article;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamiltonian_graph .

member.value: true if this instance is acyclic; otherwise, false.

item.description: Initially the Indices collection needs to be initialized with -1 to set the nodes which haven't been visited.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Node`2.Outgoing
member.summary: Get the node's outgoing links.

item.description: If the node is directed (i.e. IsDirected = true) then this collection is the same as the AllLinks collection.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.GlidingStyle.Diamond
member.summary: The connections attached to a gliding connector will glide along a rhombus (diamond polygon) with dimensions equal to the bounds of the shape.

member.summary: The connections attached to a gliding connector will glide along a right triangle with dimensions equal to the bounds of the shape.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.GlidingStyle.Triangle
member.summary: The connections attached to a gliding connector will glide along a triangle with dimensions equal to the bounds of the shape.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.IgnoreInvisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the non-visible diagram items have to be taken into account. If set to true shapes with Visibility not set to Visible will be ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.IgnoreContainers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the shape containers are ignored when laying out the graph. If false the shape containers will be considered as ordinary shapes in the tree layout process. You can additionally set the flag to perform a separate layout pass on the content of the containers. On the other hand, if this property is set to true the flag will have no effect since the layout process will be oblivious to the containers.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.LayoutContainerChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content of the containers is processed on top of the global layout. This flag has only an effect if is set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.ComponentMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the component margin.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.ComponentsGridWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the components grid.
member.value: The width of the components grid.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.EndRadialAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the end angle of the radial layout.
member.remarks: The radial layout allows you to use a sector instead of the full 360 degrees. This end angle defines the end of this sector.
member.value: The start radial angle in radians. The default is two times Pi.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.HorizontalSeparation
member.summary: The horizontal distance between siblings.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.KeepComponentsInOneRadialLayout
member.summary: When using radial layout on a forest one can either apply the layout to the trees connected via a fictive common root or apply the radial to each tree and layout each component on a grid.
member.value: true if the trees need to be in one diagram layout; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.TreeLayoutType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the layout.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.RadialSeparation
member.summary: The radial separation between layers.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.RadialFirstLEvelSeparation
member.summary: The radial distance between the root and the first level.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.Roots
member.summary: Gets the roots of the forest.
member.remarks: A forest is a collection of tree graphs. If you have one or multiple roots you can add them to this collection and they will be taken at the root for the layout. If not then the most probable tree root will be analyzed (on the basis of the longest path in the graph).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.TreeLayoutSettings.StartRadialAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the start angle of the radial layout.
member.remarks: The radial layout allows you to use a sector instead of the full 360 degrees. This start angle defines the beginning of this sector.
member.value: The start radial angle in radians. The default is zero.

list.item: This property is set to true as soon as one of the Bezier handles has been manually modified or the intermediate points have changed. If this property is true the connection routing and the automatic bezier handles are halted. You re-enable this functionality by re-setting this property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IDiagramItem.IsDynamic
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this item is dynamically generated.
member.value: If true then this item will not be serialized as part of the diagram.
member.remarks: In some applications or embeddings of RadDiagram (e.g. workflows) there are shapes or connections which are generated as part of some layout or organization. In those cases it doesn't make sense to serialize the elements which are automatically generated as part of the application. By setting this property to true the serialization pipeline will omit the element.

member.summary: Gets or sets the penalty value for a connection which overlaps another connection. Note: This property has effect only when is True. Default value is 0.75.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.AStarRouter.GetSiblingNodes(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Routing.AStar.AStarNode,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Rect,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Orientation,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the sibling nodes.
Calculates the bend alteration.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.AStarRouter.CalculateWallPenalty(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Routing.AStar.AStarNode,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the wall penalty.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.AStarRouter.IsPathDivergent(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Routing.AStar.AStarNode,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Routing.AStar.AStarNode,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates whether to cut the algorithm if no path is found in reasonable time or with reasonable distance. Using the heuristic function to determine if the searched path is getting AWAY from the target (happens when algorithm keeps missing the target). Not using total path cost, because there is no obvious relation between total path cost and start-end distance (getting through walls and bends). Adding a base value for short paths (start-end distance is small).

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.AStarRouter.Route(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Orientation,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Rect,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate a path between start point and end point. The returned path is from start point to a proximity of the end point (i.e. the found path may not reach the end point). The algorithm tries to find the cheapest path (sometimes shortest path) using a cost function. Cost function (F) has two components and is based on several factors: 1)distance between nodes; 2) whether the node is obstacle (wall); 3)whether the path is bending (turning). If no path is found a path of two points (start-end) is returned.

member.summary: Given a point on the edge of a shape, this returns the middle point of the edge adjacent to it in the clockwise direction.
member.param: The point on the edge of the shape.
member.remarks: This method is called when the routing algorithm is unable to find a route from the given starting point and an alternative starting point at the edge of the shape is necessary.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.RoutingBase.FindCrossings(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IConnection,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point@,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point@)
member.summary: Finds the crossings.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.RoutingBase.FindMostProbableTuple(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IConnection)
member.summary: Given the connection, the most probable start and end points are returned together with some additional points if necessary.
member.param: The connection which is being routed.
member.returns:
A tuple containing
the source point; this is the start point given by the connection
the intermediate start point: the point which is not necessarily on the grid but which forms the corner between the endpoint of the connection and the nearest grid point. It's defined by the place where the endpoint is located on the shape. If the endpoint is free (because the connection is free at that point) the intermediate endpoint is NaN.
the actual start point for the routing procedure
the end point of the routing procedure
the intermediate end point: analog as the intermediate start point.
the target point; this is the end or target point given by the connection.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.RoutingBase.GetSector(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Rect)
member.summary: Gets the sector.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.RoutingBase.GetNearestGridPoint(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point)
member.summary: Gets the nearest point on the routing grid for the given point.
member.remarks: The point falls either inside a square of the grid or sits on a grid point. In both case, calculating the four distances to the four corners of a grid wherein the point sits and taking the minimum distance will result in the nearest grid point.
member.param: The point for which the nearest grid point has to be returned.
member.returns: The nearest point on the grid.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.RoutingBase.GetNearestGridPoint(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,System.String,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point,Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Point@)

member.summary: Gets the sector in which the given point/vector sits.
member.remarks: The splitting is not in the usual quadrants but rather the sector defined by the diagonals x=y and x=-y.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaLayout
member.summary:
The Sugiyama or layered layout implementation.
This algorithm has the following features;
nodes are placed on layers
crossings minimization: edge crossings are minimized
minimum separation: on each layer, neighboring nodes are separated by at least a certain distance
balance: parents are placed at the barycenter of their children
proximity: neighboring nodes in the immediately upper layer are placed nearby
For additional material on this algorithm, see:
Wikipedia; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Layered_graph_drawing
"Graph drawing and applications" by Kozo Sugiyama, ISBN 981-02-4879-2. Page 29 to 35 gives a description of the algorithm.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaLayout.Layout(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.IGraph,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a layout pass.
member.param: The diagram control which needs to be laid out.

member.summary: Layout of the specified container without iterating into possible children containers.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor
member.summary:
Sugiyama layout of a single connected graph.
The process consists of the following steps:
layering: the longest path in the component determines the number of layers
normalization:
nodes ordering:
positioning: the actual positions (or bounding rectangles) are set.

member.summary: Performs a layout pass on a connected component.

member.summary: Returns the position of the node as an average of the future and past positions.

member.summary: Gets sizes of the columns.

member.summary: Layout of a single layer.
member.param: If set to true we move down in the layer stack.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.SwapPairs(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Swaps a pair of nodes in a layer.
member.param: The Nth node in the layer.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.HandlePathologies
member.summary: Swaps pairs in a layer to see if it reduces the crossings. This remediates the situations when nodes with identical incidence (local graph structure) are not positioned well by the previous crossing reduction step. The crossing reduction can indeed lead to equal position values (and hence next to another after the sorting) but crossings. Hence the swapping of neighbors and this extra step to reduce the crossings, if any.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.AddChildren(Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.Node{Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaData,System.Object})
member.summary: Recursively adds the children across layers.
member.param: A node whose children might have to be added (initial the nodes from the longest path are used).

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.CountLinksCrossingBetweenTwoLayers(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Counts the number of links crossing between two layers.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.InsertDummies
member.summary: Inserts dummy nodes to break long links.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.RemoveDummies
member.summary: Removes the dummy nodes inserted earlier to break long links.
member.remarks: The virtual nodes are effectively turned into intermediate connection points.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.OptimizeCrossings
member.summary: Optimizes/reduces the crossings between the layers by turning the crossing problem into a (combinatorial) number ordering problem.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.OptimizeCrossings(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Optimizes the crossings.
member.remarks: The big trick here is the usage of weights or values attached to connected nodes which turn a problem of crossing links to an a problem of ordering numbers.
member.param: If set to true we move down in the layer stack.
member.returns: The number of nodes having moved, i.e. the number of crossings reduced.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.UpdateHistoryPositions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the of all the nodes in the layer by taking an average weight of the linked nodes' position.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.UpdateFuturePositions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the of all the nodes in the layer by taking an average weight of the linked nodes' position.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.CheckConnectedNodesOnSameLayer
member.summary: Checks the connected nodes on same layer. If any, we move them to the next layer.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.NodeOrderComparer
member.summary: Compares nodes on the basis of their average order.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaProcessor.HistoryPositionComparer
member.summary: Compares nodes on the basis of their relative median position (i.e. the average between the future and history weights).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaSettings.IgnoreContainers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the shape containers are ignored when laying out the graph. If false the shape containers will be considered as ordinary shapes in the tree layout process. You can additionally set the flag to perform a separate layout pass on the content of the containers. On the other hand, if this property is set to true the flag will have no effect since the layout process will be oblivious to the containers.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaSettings.IgnoreInvisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the non-visible diagram items have to be taken into account. If set to true shapes with Visibility not set to Visible will be ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Diagrams.Core.SugiyamaSettings.LayoutContainerChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content of the containers is processed on top of the global layout. This flag has only an effect if is set to false.

member.summary: Generates the container for the given item.

item.description: If the item is an IShape or an IConnection then the item is its own container.
If the item implements the ILink interface an IConnection will be returned.
A generic object (like a string or a control) will have an IShape as container and the item will be put in the Content.
